name: Wall Slides
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and about 2-3 inches away from a wall.

2. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder height, with your arms almost fully extended and your elbows slightly bent.

3. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine, keeping your body straight and your shoulders relaxed.

4. Take a deep breath in and slide your back down the wall as you exhale, maintaining control throughout the movement.

5. Continue sliding down until you feel a gentle stretch in your chest, shoulders, or other target muscles, depending on your body positioning.

6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement to allow your body to relax and absorb the stretch.

7. Slowly return to the starting position by pushing back up onto your toes, maintaining control throughout the movement.

8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, taking breaks as needed between sets.
short_summary: Wall slides is a stretching exercise that targets the chest and shoulders, performed by sliding down a wall while engaging core muscles.
